ImageProcessing¶

This class contains static methods that act as stand alone functions. They perform image processing routines on images and are used by the Image object

Class¶

class improcpy.image.ImageProcessing¶

A class contains static methods for use in image processing, all methods take in an image input that can either be a numpy array or Image object

static alpha_blend(image1, image2, alpha=0.5)¶

Blends to images together according to an alpha factor

Parameters

  • image1 (numpy array) – first image to blend, has proportion alpha

  • image2 (numpy array) – second image to blend, has proportion (1-alpha)

  • alpha (float or numpy array) – factor to blend the values, must be between 0-1, can be a mask (default 0.5)

Returns

the blended image

Return type

numpy array

static blur_gray(image, size=3)¶

Takes in an image and returns a corresponding result that has been blurred (spatially filtered) using a uniform averaging.

Parameters

the edited image

Return type

numpy array

static cropper(image, width, height, x=0, y=0)¶

crops an image starting at the leftmost point x y with size width x height

Parameters

  • image (numpy array) – the image to transform

  • width (int) – the width of the cropped image

  • height (int) – the height of the cropped image

  • x (int) – the starting point of the x axis of the image (default 0)

  • y (int) – the starting point of the y axis of the image (default 0)

Returns

the edited image

Return type

numpy array

static cross_dissolve(image1, image2, num_steps=10)¶

Takes in 2 color images of the same size and returns an array of alpha blend of those two images

Parameters

  • image1 (numpy array) – first image to blend, has proportion alpha

  • image2 (numpy array) – second image to blend, has proportion (1-alpha)

  • num_steps (int) – number of steps in the array that slowly blends the images

Returns

a list of the output images starting from mostly image1 and ending with mostly image2

Return type

list [numpy array]

Examples¶

from matplotlib.pyplot import imread
from improcpy.image import ImageProcessing as ip
image = imread("sample_images/cosmo.jpg")
ip.plot_image_full(image, "cosmo", path="sample_tested/cosmo")

image = ip.to_gray_scale(image)
ip.plot_image_full(image, "gray cosmo", path="sample_tested/cosmo_gray", color=False)

image = GrayImage(path="sample_images/cosmo.jpg")
X, Y = np.meshgrid(np.linspace(-10, 10, image.shape[1]), np.linspace(-10, 10, image.shape[0]))
H = np.exp(-(X ** 2 + Y ** 2) / (2.0 * 0.5 ** 2))
image = ip.dft_filter(image, H)
ip.plot_image_full(image, "blurry cosmo", path="sample_tested/cosmo_blend", color=False)
